definition: to be completely convinced/to fully accept another person's views
sincere/authentic/really/truly
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
to submit cheerfully/to accept willingly (idiom)

sentences.english: That the 32 points Kobe Bryant hung on them three days earlier would have been convincing enough.
sentences.chinese: 三天前拿下32分的科比已经令人心悦诚服了。

sentences.english: His life was one single service for Germany.
sentences.chinese: 他的一生是为德意志竭诚服务的一生。

sentences.english: And meritorious service in the new and old customers, to create a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 竭诚服务于新老客户，共创美好明天。

sentences.english: Finally, the other willingly left a pamphlet issued by Wang Chang-lock.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对方心悦诚服地留下了王长锁发放的小册子。

sentences.english: It only took a convincing patina of truth.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是令人心悦诚服的真相表层罢了。

sentences.english: Seeing his painting, we will be sincerely convinced.
sentences.chinese: 看了他的画，我们会觉得心悦诚服。

sentences.english: An open enemy is better than a hollow friend.
sentences.chinese: 一个公开的敌人比一个诚服的朋友好。

sentences.english: All employees of the Company is willing to serve you.
sentences.chinese: 本公司全体员工愿为您竭诚服务。

sentences.english: There was about Jephson a hard, integrated earnestness which soon convinced Clyde.
sentences.chinese: 杰甫逊的坚决与认真立刻使克莱德心悦诚服。

sentences.english: The successful practice of "one country, two systems" has completely convinced the public.
sentences.chinese: “一国两制”的成功实践，让人心悦诚服。

definition: to acknowledge allegiance to (some regime)/to serve
to submit cheerfully/to accept willingly (idiom)
to overawe/to be scared into submission
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
deference/esteem/to admire
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
to have faith in/to believe in/to have confidence in/to respect
convinced/to admire from the heart/enchanted
to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
deferential/respectful
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to give one's allegiance/(popular) support
deeply grateful
